channel.title: Help! Pc upgrade
channel.description:
My 2 year old computer is in need of an upgrade.
Here are the specs:
P4 2.6ghz 512 (256 x 2) MB RAM Winfast A180B Nvidia geforce4 mx4000 video card Integrated Audio (=P) Windows XP Home Service Pack 2
I was thinking along the lines of more memory, since that seems to be what's bogging me down mainly. The video card can wait until next Christmas...I think.
Here are the specs of my MoBo (not exact model, but close, it is a VIARAMA U8568 (Pro)/U8668 (Pro)/U8868):
Specs (these mean nothing to me, how about you):
[code]168-pin DIMM Banking 2 (2 banks of 1) 184-pin DIMM Banking 2 (2 banks of 1) Chipset VIA ProSavageDDR P4M266 DDR SDRAM Frequencies PC1600 and PC2100 Error Detection Support Non-ECC only Graphics Support AGP 4X Max Unbuffered DDR SDRAM 2048MB Max Unbuffered SDR SDRAM 2048MB Module Types Supported Unbuffered only SDR SDRAM Frequencies PC100 and PC133 Supported DRAM Types SDR SDRAM and DDR SDRAM USB Support 2.x Compliant[/code]
OR: http://www.biostar.com.tw/products/mainboard/board.php?name=U8668-D%20v4/5
Do you have any suggestions for upgrades (RAM, etc?)
EDIT: If I didn't mention before, I'm on a really, really strict budget, so no $400 upgrades, k?
Thanks in advance, ~Slayerexpert~

item.title: Help! Pc upgrade
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Visit Crucial.net for ram upgrades. Make sure you know how to fit it.

Read full topic

item.title: Help! Pc upgrade
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

I have a ton worse than that, and I’m fine. Is there any reason to upgrade? Why not wait another year until ram and stuff are cheaper? Maybe then there will be some Vista-only programs (maybe not) so you’ll be forced to upgrade both your OS and system.

Read full topic

item.title: Help! Pc upgrade
item.dc:creator: @Slayerexpert Slayerexpert
item.description:
@Slayerexpert wrote:

My 2 year old computer is in need of an upgrade.

Here are the specs:

P4 2.6ghz
512 (256 x 2) MB RAM
Winfast A180B Nvidia geforce4 mx4000 video card
Integrated Audio (=P)
Windows XP Home Service Pack 2

I was thinking along the lines of more memory, since that seems to be what’s bogging me down mainly. The video card can wait until next Christmas…I think.

Here are the specs of my MoBo (not exact model, but close, it is a VIARAMA U8568 (Pro)/U8668 (Pro)/U8868):

Specs (these mean nothing to me, how about you):

168-pin DIMM Banking 2 (2 banks of 1) 184-pin DIMM Banking 2 (2 banks of 1) Chipset VIA ProSavageDDR P4M266 DDR SDRAM Frequencies PC1600 and PC2100 Error Detection Support Non-ECC only Graphics Support AGP 4X Max Unbuffered DDR SDRAM 2048MB Max Unbuffered SDR SDRAM 2048MB Module Types Supported Unbuffered only SDR SDRAM Frequencies PC100 and PC133 Supported DRAM Types SDR SDRAM and DDR SDRAM USB Support 2.x Compliant

OR:
http://www.biostar.com.tw/products/mainboard/board.php?name=U8668-D%20v4/5

Do you have any suggestions for upgrades (RAM, etc?)

EDIT: If I didn’t mention before, I’m on a really, really strict budget, so no $400 upgrades, k?

Thanks in advance,
~Slayerexpert~
